alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 11 at 8:35AM CDT until September 16 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Quad Cities IA IL has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River near Joslin affecting Whiteside, Henry IL and Rock Island Counties. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Rock River near Joslin. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding of unprotected agricultural land occurs. Water also affects Lundeens Landing Campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 5.6 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
